item.title: My Pain is Worse Than Your Pain
item.dc:creator: TC Boyle
item.description: I like my wife fine and we had a pretty smooth run of it over the years but there was a sort of — oh, what do I want to say here?

item.title: The Relive Box
item.dc:creator: TC Boyle
item.description: Katie wanted to relive Katie at nine, before her mother left, and I could appreciate that, but we had only one console at the time, and I really didn’t want to go there.

item.title: The Silence
item.dc:creator: TC Boyle
item.description: What a dragonfly was doing out here in the desert, he couldn’t say.

item.title: Something Better Than This
item.dc:creator: TC Boyle
item.description: It's one of those raw, wrung out Yonge Street Saturday mornings. The smog-gray sky is just congealing into blue over the buildings and concrete.

item.title: Modern Love
item.dc:creator: TC Boyle
item.description: There was no exchange of body fluids on the first date, and that suited both of us just fine

item.title: The Fugitive

item.description: They told him he had to wear a mask in public. Which was ridiculous.

item.title: Apologia
item.dc:creator: Stephen Westfall
item.description: To me, a story is an exercise of the imagination—or, as Flannery O’Connor has it, an act of discovery.

item.title: The Night of the Satellite
item.dc:creator: TC Boyle
item.description: That was the defining moment. My shirt was wet. I’d been humiliated, and adrenaline was rocketing through my veins. And that was how we found ourselves

item.title: A Death of Kitchawank
item.dc:creator: TC Boyle
item.description: Short story about the life of a housewife in Kitchawank Village.

item.title: Thirteen Hundred Rats
item.dc:creator: TC Boyle
item.description: There was a man in the narrator’s village who never had a pet of any kind until his wife died.

item.title: The Lie
item.dc:creator: TC Boyle
item.description: Short story about a man who plays hooky from work and lies to his boss about his baby dying. The narrator had used up all his sick days, but when the alarm…

item.title: Sin Dolor
item.dc:creator: TC Boyle
item.description: Short story about Dámaso, a Mexican boy who feels no physical pain, and the doctor who becomes a part of his life.

item.title: La Conchita
item.dc:creator: TC Boyle
item.description: Short story about a messenger delivering a liver for transplant; he is caught in a mudslide, and ends up digging a man and a child out of the mud.

item.title: Nighttime in the Pool
item.dc:creator: TC Boyle
item.description: Student days, summer in the Tropics. We were four: me and my wife, my wife’s sister, Linda, and Linda’s husband, Scottie.

item.title: When I woke up this morning, everything I had was gone

item.description: The man I want to tell you about, the one I met at the bar at Jimmy’s Steak House, was on a tear.

item.title: My Widow

item.description: My widow likes cats. No one knows exactly how many cats inhabit the big solid old redwood house I left her...

item.title: Friendly Skies
item.dc:creator: TC Boyle
item.description: When Engine 3 experiences a “glitch,” Ellen turns to her meringue-haired seat-mate for comfort and finds none.

item.title: The Love of My Life
item.dc:creator: TC Boyle
item.description: They wore each other like a pair of socks. He was at her house, she was at his.
